subject: Re: [junit] Setup inheritance
msgSnippet: Hm. I think our original poster just missed out on a chance to learn something. To the original poster: please read up on inheritance anyway -- if you re a
messageBody:
Hm. I think our original poster just missed out on a chance to learn
something.

To the original poster: please read up on inheritance anyway -- if
you're a student, then it's good for you to know about, and if you're a
professional, people out there will assume you know it.

Best of luck.

*********** REPLY SEPARATOR ***********

On 2002-07-18 at 15:46 Eric Heikkila wrote:

>Shorter answer...
>
>... make sure you have something like the following:
>
>public BaseClass extends TestCase {
>
> public void setUp() {
> System.out.println("BaseClass");
> }
>}
>
>public KiddieClass extends BaseClass {
> public void setUp() {
> super.setUp();
> System.out.println("Kiddie");
> }
>}
>
>----------------------------------------
>(Make sure you're calling super.setUp() in the child
>classes).
>
>
